Note: In Cogtse and Brag-bar, the cognate is a lexical suffix.
In Brag-bar and Japhug, the cognates mean 'father's sister's child.' In tibetan, it means 'grandchild, nephew'.
Cogtse/Brag-bar: garment, Japhug: to wear, Tibetan: clothes
Gyalrong cognates: onion. Tibetan cognate: wild onion.

Source_gloss: there is no X such that X...

Note: Cogtse: drop (classifier); the Old Chinese reconstruction is not from B-S.
Tibetan and Cogtse: son-in-law, Japhu: husband
Cogtse: to plant, Brag-bar: farming, Tibetan: farmland
Japhug: to hit, Tibetan: to beat
Gyalrong cognates: to bury; Tibetan: to dig
Cogtse: to fall (from hand), Japhug: to fall
OC not in BS; Gyalrong cognates: to carry water on back
Gyalrong cognates: dark side of the mountain
